sense.name: hesitate or stumble in action or purpose
sense.examples: Shogun Lodge, a winner of $4.64 million, appeared to suffer a massive heart attack as he faltered and fell near the 1000-metre mark. The screen went dark and she faltered as her eyes turned to the controls. He faltered after the all star break. The team should have moved him. Western Union has had major losses in recent years as its telex business has faltered in the face of competition. Liz's resolve never faltered.

sense.name: speak haltingly or weakly
sense.examples: He faltered for an instant; then went on with his speech. Hannah faltered: I . . . I just don't know.
